,safe,Mika1h,"'''''AquaNox''''' is a series of [[submarine]]-based [[first-person shooter]]/[[Submarine simulator
column2: simulation]] [[video game]]s set in the distant future. The collection includes ''AquaNox'', ''AquaNox 2: Revelation'' and ''AquaNox: The Angel's Tears''. The predecessor and the starter of the series is the [[MS-DOS]] title ''[[Archimedean Dynasty]]''.

column1: In the middle of the 22nd century, raw materials on [[Earth]] became increasingly scarce and as the end of the resources loomed, people began to prospect for resources on the ocean floor. This resulted in the construction of mining stations beneath the [[Pacific Ocean
column4: Indian ocean]]s. Many countries set up these deep-sea stations where workers and engineers extracted the oceans' treasures. Nevertheless, the output was far from enough to cover an ever-increasing demand. When the natural resources on Earth's surface were depleted, a time of destruction and wars began. In the fight over the planet's last remaining resources, alliances fell apart, countries became hostile and old conflicts flared up.

column1: With increasing cruelty and senselessness, man destroyed the very basis of life on the surface of the earth. After a series of resource wars, nuclear weapons [[nuclear holocaust
column2: completed the destruction]] that man had not yet finished with his industrial pollution. When the last glimmer of hope for humanity's survival was extinguished, people fled into the depths of the oceans.

column1: The former extraction stations became the last refuge of those fortunate enough to be able to pay the price of entry into the underwater world. The poorest of the poor were left behind, condemned to die in a desolate world polluted by radioactivity. Life outside the oceans became impossible as the continents were flooded by rising sea levels and a harsh [[nuclear winter]] covered most of the oceans and the shrinking surface landmass of the planet with a layer of [[radioactive dust]], snow and ice many meters thick. A 40-meter thick layer of dead organic matter, the so-called POM layer, covered the oceans. Not a single ray of sunlight penetrated the dense particulate layer that plunged the world into a darkness like none other. Nevertheless, mankind rose one last time to a new life, the only life, in a dead new world. This world was humanity's creation, and was now called Aqua. The following events take place in the middle of the 27th century.

Today, in the year 2661, mankind lives in gigantic cities underwater. Aqua is divided into political power blocs, such as the Aquatoria of the capitalistic, democratically governed Atlantic Federation, the [[oligarchy]] of the Arabic Clans Union and the [[monarchy
column2: monarchist]] Russo-Japanese [[Shogunate]]. In the South Pacific lies the Tornado Zone, stirred up by surface storms, where an anarchist pack of mercenaries, pirates, buccaneers and outlaws gathers, ever ready to sell their friends and their souls.

column1: A single company has long ago monopolized many industries necessary for human survival underwater—EnTrOx, which stands for \"Energy-Transportation-[[Oxygen]]\". New technologies allow extremely fast underwater travel. However, many old technologies are lost or have become useless. For example, due to the high amounts of [[nuclear fallout
column2: fallout]] in the atmosphere, satellite communication and [[Global Positioning System
column3: global positioning]] are impossible, although some organizations are looking for ways to restore these abilities.

column1: The player's task is to complete a series of story-related combat missions. During the course of the missions additional support and story elements are revealed by the secondary characters. The enemies range from hostile vessels to alien or artificial life-forms such as Bionts.
The Aquanox series include the following games, listed by the release in a [[chronological order]]:

The player once again jumps into the role of Emerald \"Deadeye\" Flint. After the Bionts are defeated, Flint goes back to being a mercenary as a leader of a Biont-hunting task force. Things turn for the worse when his submarine, the ''[[Succubus]]'', is stolen on one of the stations. The game begins with one of Flint's dubious acquaintances giving him an old, barely working sub and several missions to get him started.

Throughout the game, Flint earns money by completing missions, allowing him to purchase better subs, weapons and equipment. The new equipment appears throughout the game, available for purchase, as the player progress in the storyline. Generally speaking, the player is allowed to buy a new boat and a new set of weaponry per chapter. While on stations, Flint can speak with various characters in order to get new missions and deepen the atmosphere of the game.

The former system of upgrading the vessel with a variety of defensive turrets has been simplified by fixing the player's view to the cockpit as well as permitting the usage of only two on-hull-installed cannons. As the result of this change, the controls of the submarine have been adapted to the first-person shooter's mouse-based layout, removing the need for the joystick, thus the game has compromised its tactical depth in order to increase the intensity of combat. This change has raised critique among the reviewers, stating that the developers' focus fell inadequately on the visual performance rather than the actual gameplay of its predecessor. {{quote
column2: ...But while ''Archimedean Dynasty'' was a complex, mission-based simulation with trading and privateering, ''AquaNox'' is an arcade-style action game that abandons or greatly simplifies those elements. Combat is fast paced and more similar in style to Quake's, or even a rail shooter's, than it is to the more tactical battles in other underwater sims.

column1: The game was one of the first applications to fully use the [[Transform, clipping, and lighting
column2: T&L effects]] by supporting the ''[[NVIDIA]] Geforce 3 Ti'' graphics accelerator.{{quote
column3: Considering the game engine has been used for months to market Nvidia's flagship GeForce 3 video card, it's no surprise that the graphics are outstanding. The game has been designed to take advantage of all the high-end capabilities of the GeForce and its latest generation of cards, and the environments look amazing as a result. Textures are colourful and extremely detailed, and there are numerous little graphical touches, such as chips that flake off underwater hills hit by your projectile weapons.

column1: The game includes a vast amount of ''true'' information on oceans, such as origins of different species, their specifics and man's adaptation to submarine life. The game manual consists of two chapters explaining various terms and facts that have been mentioned throughout the course of the story.

The plot of the game centers on William Drake, the last remnant of the old aristocratic, industrialist family. After the bankruptcy of the family business and the death of the protagonist's grandmother, young William Drake sets \"sail\" for open seas on the last freighter of Drake Enterprises. The cargo ship soon gets taken over by a group of mercenaries while Drake rushes out to answer a distress call. While sparing his life, the group of seven invaders seize control of the boat, thus binding Williams' fate to their own. Drake sees no other option but to ally himself with his new crew, hoping for the best.

The game features a total of four unique, playable and upgradeable gunships. The player most likely switches boats depending on a given mission's parameters. While certain missions require speed and stealth, others virtually require a heavy arsenal and thick plating. The game features a large variety of projectile armament as well as a set of torpedoes and a collection of directed energy weaponry, including lasers and [[Electromagnetic pulse
column2: EMP]] launchers. The torpedo combat is similar to the missile engagements of most flight simulators and space shooters, where the pilot is expected to release flares and perform classic evasion manoeuvres.

column1: Traveling is generally a simple matter of following the navigation points spread out through the game. The ship's controls can be switched from the [[First-person shooter
column2: FPS]] mode to Simulation Mode via a predefined shortcut, where the latter steering scheme switches the horizontal scrolling of the mouse from turning the cockpit horizontally to rotating the hull around its axis. Reaching the surface is not possible due to the depth-range limitation, which binds the player to the underwater world yet gives certain disadvantages during combat.

column1: In response to criticisms of poor interaction with other characters in AquaNox, a new dialogue system was added in the sequel. Between missions, the player is able to initiate conversations while on board the freighter as well as in the oceanic cities. The initiation of the conversations is mandatory. However, due to the absence of interaction during the dialogues, the outcome of the game is not open-ended. The dialogue and characters are the focus of many reviewers' ire, who criticize it as poorly-written and ultimately pointless.<ref>{{cite news

''AquaNox: The Angel's Tears'' is the [[PlayStation 2]] [[remake]] of ''AquaNox 2: Revelation''. The title did not pass Sony's [[software quality assurance]] test and as [[Massive Development]] had already been closed by [[JoWood Productions]], the release was cancelled.

column2: Nordic Games]] presented a [[tech demo]] of a new iteration from the Aquanox series. The Nordic Games officials confirmed they were working on a new iteration of the game. The demo was created using Unreal Engine 3 and showed a bit of the environment and one ship model prototype along with a hangar interface.<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Aquanox 3 - Nachfolger namens Aquanox: Deep Descent offiziell in Entwicklung durch Nordic Games! - Vorstellung 2014 auf der Gamescom + erste Videos des Pre-Alpha Prototypen *Update 19.08.2014*
column6: accessdate=27 December 2019}}</ref> The game was successfully [[crowdfunded]] through [[Kickstarter]] on the 11th of September 2015 by amassing US$95,979, surpassing its US$75,000 goal.<ref>{{cite web

column1: * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110713122947/http://www.jowood.com/?site=2&lang=eng&GameID=aquanox&pfid=PC Official Aquanox Homepage] of the publisher Jowood (archived 2011-07-13)
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20110713123000/http://www.jowood.com/?lang=eng&site=2&gameid=aquanox_r&pfid=PC Official Aquanox 2 Homepage] of the publisher Jowood (archived 2011-07-13)
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20050207103431/http://www.aquanox-portal.com/index_eng.htm AquaNox-Portal] - Official AquaNox Series webpage from ''Massive Development'' (archived 2005-02-07)
[[Category:Video games set in the 27th century]]","'''''AquaNox''''' is a series of [[submarine]]-based [[first-person shooter]]/[[Vehicle simulation game
column2: simulation]] [[video game]]s set in the distant future. The collection includes ''AquaNox'', ''AquaNox 2: Revelation'' and ''AquaNox: The Angel's Tears''. The predecessor and the starter of the series is the [[MS-DOS]] title ''[[Archimedean Dynasty]]''.

column1: In the middle of the 22nd century, raw materials on [[Earth]] became increasingly scarce and as the end of the resources loomed, people began to prospect for resources on the ocean floor. This resulted in the construction of mining stations beneath the [[Pacific Ocean
column4: Indian ocean]]s. Many countries set up these deep-sea stations where workers and engineers extracted the oceans' treasures. Nevertheless, the output was far from enough to cover an ever-increasing demand. When the natural resources on Earth's surface were depleted, a time of destruction and wars began. In the fight over the planet's last remaining resources, alliances fell apart, countries became hostile and old conflicts flared up.

column1: With increasing cruelty and senselessness, man destroyed the very basis of life on the surface of the earth. After a series of resource wars, nuclear weapons [[nuclear holocaust
column2: completed the destruction]] that man had not yet finished with his industrial pollution. When the last glimmer of hope for humanity's survival was extinguished, people fled into the depths of the oceans.

column1: The former extraction stations became the last refuge of those fortunate enough to be able to pay the price of entry into the underwater world. The poorest of the poor were left behind, condemned to die in a desolate world polluted by radioactivity. Life outside the oceans became impossible as the continents were flooded by rising sea levels and a harsh [[nuclear winter]] covered most of the oceans and the shrinking surface landmass of the planet with a layer of [[radioactive dust]], snow and ice many meters thick. A 40-meter thick layer of dead organic matter, the so-called POM layer, covered the oceans. Not a single ray of sunlight penetrated the dense particulate layer that plunged the world into a darkness like none other. Nevertheless, mankind rose one last time to a new life, the only life, in a dead new world. This world was humanity's creation, and was now called Aqua. The following events take place in the middle of the 27th century.

Today, in the year 2661, mankind lives in gigantic cities underwater. Aqua is divided into political power blocs, such as the Aquatoria of the capitalistic, democratically governed Atlantic Federation, the [[oligarchy]] of the Arabic Clans Union and the [[monarchy
column2: monarchist]] Russo-Japanese [[Shogunate]]. In the South Pacific lies the Tornado Zone, stirred up by surface storms, where an anarchist pack of mercenaries, pirates, buccaneers and outlaws gathers, ever ready to sell their friends and their souls.

column1: A single company has long ago monopolized many industries necessary for human survival underwater—EnTrOx, which stands for \"Energy-Transportation-[[Oxygen]]\". New technologies allow extremely fast underwater travel. However, many old technologies are lost or have become useless. For example, due to the high amounts of [[nuclear fallout
column2: fallout]] in the atmosphere, satellite communication and [[Global Positioning System
column3: global positioning]] are impossible, although some organizations are looking for ways to restore these abilities.

column1: The player's task is to complete a series of story-related combat missions. During the course of the missions additional support and story elements are revealed by the secondary characters. The enemies range from hostile vessels to alien or artificial life-forms such as Bionts.
The Aquanox series include the following games, listed by the release in a [[chronological order]]:

The player once again jumps into the role of Emerald \"Deadeye\" Flint. After the Bionts are defeated, Flint goes back to being a mercenary as a leader of a Biont-hunting task force. Things turn for the worse when his submarine, the ''[[Succubus]]'', is stolen on one of the stations. The game begins with one of Flint's dubious acquaintances giving him an old, barely working sub and several missions to get him started.

Throughout the game, Flint earns money by completing missions, allowing him to purchase better subs, weapons and equipment. The new equipment appears throughout the game, available for purchase, as the player progress in the storyline. Generally speaking, the player is allowed to buy a new boat and a new set of weaponry per chapter. While on stations, Flint can speak with various characters in order to get new missions and deepen the atmosphere of the game.

The former system of upgrading the vessel with a variety of defensive turrets has been simplified by fixing the player's view to the cockpit as well as permitting the usage of only two on-hull-installed cannons. As the result of this change, the controls of the submarine have been adapted to the first-person shooter's mouse-based layout, removing the need for the joystick, thus the game has compromised its tactical depth in order to increase the intensity of combat. This change has raised critique among the reviewers, stating that the developers' focus fell inadequately on the visual performance rather than the actual gameplay of its predecessor. {{quote
column2: ...But while ''Archimedean Dynasty'' was a complex, mission-based simulation with trading and privateering, ''AquaNox'' is an arcade-style action game that abandons or greatly simplifies those elements. Combat is fast paced and more similar in style to Quake's, or even a rail shooter's, than it is to the more tactical battles in other underwater sims.

column1: The game was one of the first applications to fully use the [[Transform, clipping, and lighting
column2: T&L effects]] by supporting the ''[[NVIDIA]] Geforce 3 Ti'' graphics accelerator.{{quote
column3: Considering the game engine has been used for months to market Nvidia's flagship GeForce 3 video card, it's no surprise that the graphics are outstanding. The game has been designed to take advantage of all the high-end capabilities of the GeForce and its latest generation of cards, and the environments look amazing as a result. Textures are colourful and extremely detailed, and there are numerous little graphical touches, such as chips that flake off underwater hills hit by your projectile weapons.

column1: The game includes a vast amount of ''true'' information on oceans, such as origins of different species, their specifics and man's adaptation to submarine life. The game manual consists of two chapters explaining various terms and facts that have been mentioned throughout the course of the story.

The plot of the game centers on William Drake, the last remnant of the old aristocratic, industrialist family. After the bankruptcy of the family business and the death of the protagonist's grandmother, young William Drake sets \"sail\" for open seas on the last freighter of Drake Enterprises. The cargo ship soon gets taken over by a group of mercenaries while Drake rushes out to answer a distress call. While sparing his life, the group of seven invaders seize control of the boat, thus binding Williams' fate to their own. Drake sees no other option but to ally himself with his new crew, hoping for the best.

The game features a total of four unique, playable and upgradeable gunships. The player most likely switches boats depending on a given mission's parameters. While certain missions require speed and stealth, others virtually require a heavy arsenal and thick plating. The game features a large variety of projectile armament as well as a set of torpedoes and a collection of directed energy weaponry, including lasers and [[Electromagnetic pulse
column2: EMP]] launchers. The torpedo combat is similar to the missile engagements of most flight simulators and space shooters, where the pilot is expected to release flares and perform classic evasion manoeuvres.

column1: Traveling is generally a simple matter of following the navigation points spread out through the game. The ship's controls can be switched from the [[First-person shooter
column2: FPS]] mode to Simulation Mode via a predefined shortcut, where the latter steering scheme switches the horizontal scrolling of the mouse from turning the cockpit horizontally to rotating the hull around its axis. Reaching the surface is not possible due to the depth-range limitation, which binds the player to the underwater world yet gives certain disadvantages during combat.

column1: An internationally renowned award-winning producer, Amritraj has made over 100 films during the span of his 35-year career, with worldwide revenues in excess of $2 billion. <ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> He has partnered with every major studio in Hollywood and produced films starring the likes of Dwayne \"The Rock\" Johnson,<ref>{{Cite web

column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> Bruce Willis, Sandra Bullock, Sylvester Stallone, Angelina Jolie, Cate Blanchett, Dustin Hoffman, Andrew Garfield, Steve Martin, Antonio Banderas <ref>{{Cite web

column1: Amritraj’s extraordinary career from Wimbledon tennis player to billion dollar Hollywood producer (chronicled in his autobiography Advantage Hollywood <ref>{{Cite book
column9: pages=}}</ref>) is matched only by his commitment to education, diversity, and gender equality. Dedicating a significant amount of his time to philanthropic endeavors worldwide, in 2016 Amritraj was appointed as the first United Nations India Goodwill Ambassador for the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals <ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Hyde Park Entertainment’s Ashok Amritraj on His New Role as India Goodwill Ambassador
column19: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>. In December 2018, by decree of the President of the Republic of France, Amritraj was appointed a Chevalier (Knight) of the Ordre National du Merité <ref>{{Cite web
column21: title=Ashok Amritraj Decorated by French Government

column1: Amritraj has grown Hyde Park into a cutting-edge independent alternative to the traditional Hollywood system, fully realizing his vision for a progressive global company that incorporates the most essential elements of a full-fledged studio. Hyde Park’s mandate encompasses feature film, television, digital, documentary, and local language content, with the Company possessing development, production, and financing capabilities in addition to handling worldwide sales and marketing.
Amritraj has had box office hits such as GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE, starring Nicolas Cage <ref>{{Cite news
column3: title=Movie Projector: 'Ghost Rider' sequel to scorch competition
column8: issn=0458-3035}}</ref>, BRINGING DOWN THE HOUSE, starring Steve Martin <ref>{{Cite web
column18: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, PREMONITION, starring Sandra Bullock <ref>{{Cite web
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, WALKING TALL starring The Rock, and many more, as well as critically acclaimed titles including 99 HOMES starring Andrew Garfield and Michael Shannon, BLUE VALENTINE starring Ryan Gosling and Michelle Williams <ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=Right Cinema: Blue Valentine is an Indie Film
column28: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, and SHOPGIRL, starring Steve Martin and Claire Danes <ref>{{Cite web
column30: title=Fox takes international on Hyde Park ‘Shopgirl’

column21: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and FORDLANDIA, a Television event series, to be directed by Werner Herzog at AMC Studios <ref>{{Cite web

column1: Hyde Park Entertainment Group and its artists have received awards and recognition from the major award shows and film festivals including the Oscars, the BAFTA awards, the Emmys, the Independent Spirit Awards, the Cannes Film Festival, the Golden Globes, and many more.

column1: Amritraj has grown Hyde Park into a cutting-edge independent alternative to the traditional Hollywood system, fully realizing his vision for a progressive global company that incorporates the most essential elements of a full-fledged studio. Hyde Park’s mandate encompasses feature film, television, digital, documentary, and local language content, with the Company possessing development, production, and financing capabilities in addition to handling worldwide sales and marketing.
Amritraj has had box office hits such as GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE, starring Nicolas Cage <ref>{{Cite news
column3: title=Movie Projector: 'Ghost Rider' sequel to scorch competition
column8: issn=0458-3035}}</ref>, BRINGING DOWN THE HOUSE, starring Steve Martin <ref>{{Cite web
column18: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, PREMONITION, starring Sandra Bullock <ref>{{Cite web
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, WALKING TALL starring The Rock, and many more, as well as critically acclaimed titles including 99 HOMES starring Andrew Garfield and Michael Shannon, BLUE VALENTINE starring Ryan Gosling and Michelle Williams <ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=Right Cinema: Blue Valentine is an Indie Film
column28: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, and SHOPGIRL, starring Steve Martin and Claire Danes <ref>{{Cite web
column30: title=Fox takes international on Hyde Park ‘Shopgirl’

column1: Amritraj’s current projects include: supernatural thriller, PREY, in partnership with Blumhouse Productions <ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Hyde Park-Image Nation & Blumhouse Partner For ‘Prey’
column11: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, PASHMINA, a Major Animated Musical in partnership with Netflix, to be directed by Gurinder Chadha and with music by Oscar-winner A.R. Rahman <ref>{{Cite web
column13: title=Netflix Teams With Gurinder Chadha & Ashok Amritraj’s Hyde Park To Turn Nidhi Chanani Graphic Novel ‘Pashmina’ Into Animated Musical
column21: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and FORDLANDIA, a Television event series, to be directed by Werner Herzog at AMC Studios <ref>{{Cite web
column23: title=‘Fordlandia’ Novel Being Adapted For TV; Werner Herzog To Direct

column1: Hyde Park Entertainment Group and its artists have received awards and recognition from the major award shows and film festivals including the Oscars, the BAFTA awards, the Emmys, the Independent Spirit Awards, the Cannes Film Festival, the Golden Globes, and many more.
Amritraj serves on the Producers Executive Board of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences <ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and on the advisory board for the Dodge Film School at Chapman University <ref>{{Cite web
column8: title=Dodge College Moves Up to #6 Spot in The Hollywood Reporter’s Annual Ranking of Top 25 Film Schools - Maintains ‘Top 10’ Status for 5th Consecutive Year
column9: website=Dodge College of Film and Media Arts
column11: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>. In 2015, he was bestowed an honorary Doctorate of the Arts from the University of East London <ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Ashok Amritraj awarded honorary doctorate by a London Varsity

column1: Ashok lived in Chennai his mother's name is Maggie Dhairyam and father's name is Robert Amritraj. He has two brothers, [[Vijay Amritraj]] and Anand Amritraj, His brothers Vijay Amritraj,[[Anand Amritraj]] was international tennis players.
* ''Risen: The Story of the First Easter'' (2009)

column7: British]] [[venture capitalist]] based in [[London]]. He was for many years [[Chief Investment Officer]] of the [[private equity]] group [[Apax]]. He was until recently [[Chairman]] of Dawn Capital.<ref>{{cite web
column13: title=Apax veteran Beecroft returns to VC roots

column1: Among the companies in which Beecroft has personally invested are [[Mimecast]] and Insignis.{{fact
Beecroft has donated more than £500,000 to the [[Conservative Party (UK)
column3: title=Beecroft proposals: how Tory donor's radical blueprint split the government

column1: Adrian Beecroft was born and raised in [[Yorkshire]]. He studied at [[Hymers College]] in [[Kingston upon Hull
He graduated from [[Queen's College, Oxford]] with a first class honours degree in [[Physics]] in 1968 and is now an Honorary Fellow of the College.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web
column5: access-date=2018-09-04}}</ref>  In 1976 he gained a M.B.A from Harvard Business School, where he studied as a [[Harkness Fellowship
column6: Harkness Fellow]].<ref name=\":0\" />  He graduated from Harvard as a [[Baker scholar

column1: Adrian Beecroft has an extensive career in venture capital and private equity, specialising in IT investments.<ref name=\":0\" />  He was the Chairman of the [[British Venture Capital Association]] in 1991.<ref name=\":1\">{{Cite news
Beecroft started his career at [[International Computers Limited
column2: ICL]], in the computer industry.<ref name=\":1\" />  In 1973, he moved to Ocean Transport and Trading Ltd., working to develop their new business area of bulk shipping.<ref name=\":0\" />

column1: After graduating from [[Harvard Business School]], he joined [[Boston Consulting Group]] in [[London]]. He became Vice President of BCG in 1982.<ref name=\":0\" />
In 1984, Beecroft joined Apax Partners, and was there for 25 years until he retired from his role as [[Chief investment officer
column2: Chief Investment Officer]] in 2008.<ref name=\":1\" /> While working at Apax, he served as their representative on the boards of over 20 public and private companies, including [[Computacenter]], Alkane Energy and [[Healthcare at Home]]. He played a significant part in the international expansion of the business, which now has over $20 billion under management.<ref>{{Cite web

column1: In December 2006, Beecroft was appointed to the [[NESTA]] Investment Committee.<ref>http://www.official-documents.gov.uk/document/hc0607/hc06/0654/0654.pdf</ref> At that time NESTA was still a [[QUANGO]].
Beecroft was awarded the BVCA's Hall of Fame honour at the Private Equity Awards in 2009.<ref name=\":0\" />  He was a member of [[Sir David Walker
column2: Sir David Walker's]] committee on improving the transparency of the private equity industry.<ref>{{Cite web
column4: title=Walker Assembles High Flying Private Equity Working Group

column1: In 2010, Beecroft joined Dawn Capital as the Chairman of their board.<ref name=\":1\" />

On 21 May 2012, the [[Beecroft Report]] caused considerable controversy in the UK due to its recommendations to relax regulation surrounding the dismissal of employees. The report claimed this would help to boost the economy.<ref>{{cite news
column2: title=How Adrian Beecroft proposed to rip up decades of employee rights to boost the economy
column7: work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> It was alleged that significant sections of the report had been doctored.<ref name=\":2\">{{cite news
column8: title=Controversial Beecroft report on employment reform doctored by No 10
column13: work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> It was also reported that some recommendations had been removed from the original draft of the report.<ref name=\":2\" /> On 21 May [[Secretary of State for Business]] [[Vince Cable]] condemned the report, saying it was unnecessary for the government to scare workers.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=BBC News - Adrian Beecroft work report not doctored, No 10 says
column18: accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref> Beecroft responded by accusing Cable of being a socialist.<ref>{{Cite news
column20: title='Socialist' Vince Cable not fit for office, says Adrian Beecroft
column26: issn=0307-1235}}</ref> He referenced his own experience of having to pay £150,000 for unfairly dismissing an HR employee as one of the many reasons behind the recommendation in the report.<ref>{{cite news
column28: title='Socialist' Vince Cable not fit for office, says Adrian Beecroft

column3: The Beecroft Building viewed from [[Parks Road]], [[Oxford]], completed in 2018]]

column1: Beecroft helped to found and funds the Beecroft Institute of Particle Physics and Cosmology (BIPAC)<ref name=\":3\" /> at [[Oxford University]].<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Beecroft Institute of Particle Astrophysics and Cosmology
column6: accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref> He has also part-funded the [[Beecroft Building]], part of the [[Department of Physics, University of Oxford
column7: Department of Physics]] in Oxford. This new building is specifically focused on [[Theoretical physics
column10: quantum]] physics. According to ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', the funding for this building was inspired by Beecroft's interest in [[astrophysics]].<ref>{{Cite web
column12: title=Celebrating the ‘bottoming out’ of Oxford’s Beecroft Building

column1: Beecroft has supported his school, Hymer's College in Hull.<ref name=\":3\" />  He has also been a Trustee of Impetus Trust, a social impact charity.<ref name=\":3\" /> Beecroft was also for six years the Chairman of the Cricket Foundation, now known as [[Chance to Shine]], a charity focused on bringing cricket back into British state school education.<ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Cricket Foundation elects Donald Brydon as new Chairman of the Board of Trustees

column1: Through the Beecroft Trust, Adrian and his wife sponsor the [[Oxford Academy, Oxfordshire
column2: Oxford Academy]], an Academy school serving a very deprived area of Oxford.<ref>{{Cite web
column7: access-date=2018-09-07}}</ref> Since becoming an Academy school in 2010, its results have improved dramatically from 14% of the students achieving five A* to C grades including English and Maths to 56% achieving this in 2017. However, in 2019 only 17% of pupils achieved grade 5 or above at GCSE and the school had the worst Attainment 8 and Progress 8 scores of any mainstream school in Oxfordshire.<ref>{{Cite web
column9: title=School 'disappointed' to come bottom in GCSE rankings
column12: access-date=2019-12-16}}</ref> In December 2019 the Head and governing body were removed after an [[Ofsted
column15: title=Mum says school is 'like juvey' as head and governors leave

column1: Mr Beecroft has also supported the [[UNESCO]] initiative to preserve the [[Belize Barrier Reef]] Reserve System, which was classified as in danger on the UNESCO List of World Heritage in Danger in 2009.<ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Landmark Conservation Action leads to Belize Barrier Reef removal from List of World Heritage in Danger
column8: access-date=2018-09-07}}</ref>  As of June 2018, the [[World Heritage Committee]] decided to remove the Belize Barrier Reef, which is the world's second largest coral reef, from the list.<ref>{{Cite news
column10: title=Belize reef taken off 'in danger' list

column3: Adrian Beecroft in his [[Aston Martin DBR1]]]]

column2: Lord's Cricket Ground]] as a [[Marylebone Cricket Club]] (MCC) Trustee.<ref name=\":4\">{{Citation
column4: title=Meet MCC Trustee Adrian Beecroft {{!}} MCC/Lord's
column7: access-date=2018-09-07}}</ref>  As a trustee one of his core roles is assisting with the appointment of the Chairman, but also overseeing the wellbeing of the club and cricket ground.<ref>{{Cite web
column12: access-date=2018-09-07}}</ref> His enthusiasm for the sport came from watching the [[Yorkshire County Cricket Club
column13: Yorkshire County team]] play in Hull.<ref name=\":4\" />  He is the President of Cropredy Cricket Club for whom he still plays league cricket.<ref>{{Cite web

column1: Beecroft is a supporter of the [[North Yorkshire Moors Railway]] of which he is a Vice-President. He is a keen auto-enthusiast, having an extensive collection of vehicles, including several [[Aston Martin]]s, most notably a [[Aston Martin DBR1
column2: DBR1]] which he races at a number of motoring events and later crashed in 2015.<ref>http://carbuzz.com/m/Article.aspx?Id=29621</ref> He is a governor of [[Hymers College]] in Hull.

column1: '''Los Lunas''' is a village in [[Valencia County, New Mexico]], in the United States. As of the [[United States Census, 2010
column2: 2010 census]], the village population is 14,835 inside the village limits due to the new housing developments at El Cerro de Los Lunas (Huning Ranch). It is the [[county seat]] of Valencia County.<ref name=\"GR6\">{{cite web

column1: Los Lunas is part of the [[Albuquerque metropolitan area
column2: Albuquerque Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. The name \"Los Lunas\" is a partial [[Anglicization]] of the name of the Luna family, who originally settled in the area (''los Luna'', in Spanish).

column1: The original land grant was made to Don Adrian Luna Candelaria in 1716, but within two years it was given to the Luna family. Some [[American Civil War
column2: Civil War]] battles were fought near the village. Los Lunas became the county seat in 1876 and became an incorporated village in 1928. The [[Los Lunas Decalogue Stone]] is located nearby.

column18: accessdate=2011-04-23}}</ref> According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the village has a total area of 10.1 square miles (26.0 km²), all land. The village lies in the [[Albuquerque Basin]] on the west bank of the [[Rio Grande]], and is on State Highway 6, east of [[Interstate 25]]. El Cerro de Los Lunas, a volcano related to the [[Rio Grande rift]], forms a prominent landmark at the western edge of the village.

column2: title = NOWData - NOAA Online Weather Data

column1: Whereas according to the [[2010 U.S. Census]] Bureau:
As of the census<ref name=\"GR2\">{{cite web
column6: df= }}</ref> of 2000, there were 10,034 people, 3,601 households, and 2,689 families residing in the village. The population density was 998.8 people per square mile (385.5/km²). There were 3,845 housing units at an average density of 382.7 per square mile (147.7/km²). The racial makeup of the village was 64.14% [[White (U.S. Census)
column12: other races]], and 3.90% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)
column14: Latino]] of any race were 58.74% of the population.

column1: There were 3,601 households out of which 41.9% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 51.8% were married couples living together, 16.8% had a female householder with no husband present, and 25.3% were non-families. 20.7% of all households were made up of individuals and 5.8% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.75 and the average family size was 3.16.

In the village, the population was spread out with 31.1% under the age of 18, 9.6% from 18 to 24, 30.1% from 25 to 44, 20.2% from 45 to 64, and 8.9% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 32 years. For every 100 females, there were 95.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 90.1 males.

The median income for a household in the village was $36,240, and the median income for a family was $37,255. Males had a median income of $30,664 versus $22,437 for females. The per capita income for the village was $14,692. About 11.6% of families and 13.5% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 18.3% of those under age 18 and 7.3% of those age 65 or over.

Growth was rapid for Los Lunas in the 1990s and early 2000s, with the enrollment of [[Los Lunas High School]] reaching nearly 2,500 students around 2004. In fact, [[Valencia High School (Los Lunas, New Mexico)
column2: Valencia High School]] opened in 2006 as a relief valve for that enrollment, but due in part to the recession of the late 2000s, the two schools had a similar enrollment by the end of the decade.

column1: The town has been the site of two episodes of [[Breaking Bad]].

A United States Army Air Force bombing range, used by elements of the [[509th Bomb Wing]] out of [[Kirtland Army Air Field]], later [[Kirtland Air Force Base]], was located here during and after World War II.

Los Lunas' public schools are operated by [[Los Lunas Schools]], which includes three high schools, two middle schools, one intermediate school, and ten elementary schools.<ref>[http://www.llschools.net Los Lunas Schools - Home]. Llschools.net (2013-07-22). Retrieved on 2013-08-15.</ref> Another school entitled Family School is a program that allows the combination of public school and homeschooling, found on the Daniel Fernandez Elementary Campus.<ref>[http://www.llschools.net/dfi/ ]{{dead link
* Edward Tyrese, infamous half race who works at the local GameStop.
* Thomas Gould, the stepson of that boomer, Tracy Miller.
* Scott, who lives in a trailer park but it’s okay because he has 2 acres. Also suffers from having 47 chromosomes.
* [[Sal Artiaga]], Minor League Baseball president, born in Los Lunas.
* [[Bo Diddley]], rock guitarist/legend, lived in Los Lunas in the 1970s.

* [[Anton Docher]] (aka The Padre of Isleta) served as a priest in Los Lunas during his long period in [[Isleta]].<ref>Keleher and Chant. ''The Padre of Isleta''. Sunstone Press, 2009,chap.4- p. 30.36.</ref>

The village offers a variety of events to go to. Among them are annual events such as: the St. Patrick's Day Balloon Rally; [[Fourth of July]] Parade, celebration and fireworks display at Daniel Fernandez Park; and the Holiday Electric Light Parade down Main Street (NM Highway 6).
On September 14, 2016, Facebook announced their plans to open a data center in Los Lunas.<ref name=fb-20160916>{{cite news
column6: accessdate=16 September 2016}}</ref> The construction would start in October 2016, and it will be equipped with the latest in the Open Compute Project hardware designs, protected from the frequent dust storms that occur in New Mexico, and powered by 100% clean and renewable energy through solar and wind plants. This data center will support 300 new construction jobs and 50 permanent jobs.<ref>{{cite web
column8: title=Facebook chooses New Mexico over Utah for its newest data center

column2: Valencia High School]] opened in 2006 as a relief valve for that enrollment, but due in part to the recession of the late 2000s, the two schools had a similar enrollment by the end of the decade.

column1: '''Los Lunas''' is a village in [[Valencia County, New Mexico]], in the United States. As of the [[United States Census, 2010
column2: 2010 census]], the village population is 14,835 inside the village limits due to the new housing developments at El Cerro de Los Lunas (Huning Ranch). It is the [[county seat]] of Valencia County.<ref name=\"GR6\">{{cite web

column1: Los Lunas is part of the [[Albuquerque metropolitan area
column2: Albuquerque Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. The name \"Los Lunas\" is a partial [[Anglicization]] of the name of the Luna family, who originally settled in the area (''los Luna'', in Spanish).

column1: The original land grant was made to Don Adrian Luna Candelaria in 1716, but within two years it was given to the Luna family. Some [[American Civil War
column2: Civil War]] battles were fought near the village. Los Lunas became the county seat in 1876 and became an incorporated village in 1928. The [[Los Lunas Decalogue Stone]] is located nearby.

column18: accessdate=2011-04-23}}</ref> According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the village has a total area of 10.1 square miles (26.0 km²), all land. The village lies in the [[Albuquerque Basin]] on the west bank of the [[Rio Grande]], and is on State Highway 6, east of [[Interstate 25]]. El Cerro de Los Lunas, a volcano related to the [[Rio Grande rift]], forms a prominent landmark at the western edge of the village.

column1: Whereas according to the [[2010 U.S. Census]] Bureau:
As of the census<ref name=\"GR2\">{{cite web
column6: df= }}</ref> of 2000, there were 10,034 people, 3,601 households, and 2,689 families residing in the village. The population density was 998.8 people per square mile (385.5/km²). There were 3,845 housing units at an average density of 382.7 per square mile (147.7/km²). The racial makeup of the village was 64.14% [[White (U.S. Census)
column12: other races]], and 3.90% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)
column14: Latino]] of any race were 58.74% of the population.

column1: There were 3,601 households out of which 41.9% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 51.8% were married couples living together, 16.8% had a female householder with no husband present, and 25.3% were non-families. 20.7% of all households were made up of individuals and 5.8% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.75 and the average family size was 3.16.

In the village, the population was spread out with 31.1% under the age of 18, 9.6% from 18 to 24, 30.1% from 25 to 44, 20.2% from 45 to 64, and 8.9% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 32 years. For every 100 females, there were 95.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 90.1 males.

The median income for a household in the village was $36,240, and the median income for a family was $37,255. Males had a median income of $30,664 versus $22,437 for females. The per capita income for the village was $14,692. About 11.6% of families and 13.5% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 18.3% of those under age 18 and 7.3% of those age 65 or over.

Growth was rapid for Los Lunas in the 1990s and early 2000s, with the enrollment of [[Los Lunas High School]] reaching nearly 2,500 students around 2004. In fact, [[Valencia High School (Los Lunas, New Mexico)
column2: Valencia High School]] opened in 2006 as a relief valve for that enrollment, but due in part to the recession of the late 2000s, the two schools had a similar enrollment by the end of the decade.

A United States Army Air Force bombing range, used by elements of the [[509th Bomb Wing]] out of [[Kirtland Army Air Field]], later [[Kirtland Air Force Base]], was located here during and after World War II.

Los Lunas' public schools are operated by [[Los Lunas Schools]], which includes three high schools, two middle schools, one intermediate school, and ten elementary schools.<ref>[http://www.llschools.net Los Lunas Schools - Home]. column1: An internationally renowned award-winning producer, Amritraj has made over 100 films during the span of his 35-year career, with worldwide revenues in excess of $2 billion.<ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> He has partnered with every major studio in Hollywood and produced films starring the likes of Dwayne \"The Rock\" Johnson,<ref>{{Cite web
column18: title=It Is The Time Of Disruption: Ashok Amritraj
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> Bruce Willis, Sandra Bullock, Sylvester Stallone, Angelina Jolie, Cate Blanchett, Dustin Hoffman, Andrew Garfield, Steve Martin, Antonio Banderas,<ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=It Is The Time Of Disruption: Ashok Amritraj
column32: title=Toronto: Elmore Leonard’s ‘Life Of Crime’ Near U.S. Deal With Lionsgate/Roadside
column42: title=\"Ghost Rider 2\" poised to ignite lackluster franchise

column1: Amritraj’s extraordinary career from Wimbledon tennis player to billion dollar Hollywood producer (chronicled in his autobiography Advantage Hollywood<ref>{{Cite book
column9: pages=}}</ref>) is matched only by his commitment to education, diversity, and gender equality. Dedicating a significant amount of his time to philanthropic endeavors worldwide, in 2016 Amritraj was appointed as the first United Nations India Goodwill Ambassador for the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals.<ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Hyde Park Entertainment’s Ashok Amritraj on His New Role as India Goodwill Ambassador
column19: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> In December 2018, by decree of the President of the Republic of France, Amritraj was appointed a Chevalier (Knight) of the Ordre National du Merité.<ref>{{Cite web
column21: title=Ashok Amritraj Decorated by French Government

column1: Amritraj has grown Hyde Park into a cutting-edge independent alternative to the traditional Hollywood system, fully realizing his vision for a progressive global company that incorporates the most essential elements of a full-fledged studio. Hyde Park’s mandate encompasses feature film, television, digital, documentary, and local language content, with the Company possessing development, production, and financing capabilities in addition to handling worldwide sales and marketing.
Amritraj has had box office hits such as GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE, starring Nicolas Cage,<ref>{{Cite news
column3: title=Movie Projector: 'Ghost Rider' sequel to scorch competition
column8: issn=0458-3035}}</ref> BRINGING DOWN THE HOUSE, starring Steve Martin,<ref>{{Cite web
column18: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> PREMONITION, starring Sandra Bullock,<ref>{{Cite web
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> WALKING TALL starring The Rock, and many more, as well as critically acclaimed titles including 99 HOMES starring Andrew Garfield and Michael Shannon, BLUE VALENTINE starring Ryan Gosling and Michelle Williams,<ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=Right Cinema: Blue Valentine is an Indie Film
column28: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and SHOPGIRL, starring Steve Martin and Claire Danes.<ref>{{Cite web
column30: title=Fox takes international on Hyde Park ‘Shopgirl’

column1: Amritraj’s current projects include: supernatural thriller, PREY, in partnership with Blumhouse Productions <ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Hyde Park-Image Nation & Blumhouse Partner For ‘Prey’
column11: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>, PASHMINA, a Major Animated Musical in partnership with Netflix, to be directed by Gurinder Chadha and with music by Oscar-winner A.R. Rahman <ref>{{Cite web
column13: title=Netflix Teams With Gurinder Chadha & Ashok Amritraj’s Hyde Park To Turn Nidhi Chanani Graphic Novel ‘Pashmina’ Into Animated Musical
column21: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and FORDLANDIA, a Television event series, to be directed by Werner Herzog at AMC Studios <ref>{{Cite web
column23: title=‘Fordlandia’ Novel Being Adapted For TV; Werner Herzog To Direct

column1: Hyde Park Entertainment Group and its artists have received awards and recognition from the major award shows and film festivals including the Oscars, the BAFTA awards, the Emmys, the Independent Spirit Awards, the Cannes Film Festival, the Golden Globes, and many more.
Amritraj serves on the Producers Executive Board of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences <ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and on the advisory board for the Dodge Film School at Chapman University <ref>{{Cite web
column8: title=Dodge College Moves Up to #6 Spot in The Hollywood Reporter’s Annual Ranking of Top 25 Film Schools - Maintains ‘Top 10’ Status for 5th Consecutive Year
column9: website=Dodge College of Film and Media Arts
column11: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref>. In 2015, he was bestowed an honorary Doctorate of the Arts from the University of East London <ref>{{Cite news
column13: title=Ashok Amritraj awarded honorary doctorate by a London Varsity

column4: Diagram showing the five primary layers of the Earth's atmosphere: [[exosphere]], [[thermosphere]], mesosphere, [[stratosphere]], and [[troposphere]]. The layers are to scale. From Earth's surface to the top of the stratosphere (50 km) is just under 1% of Earth's radius.]]

column2: The layer of the atmosphere directly above the stratosphere and below the thermosphere}}

column10: Greek]] ''mesos'', \"middle\") is the third layer of the [[Atmosphere of Earth
column11: atmosphere]], directly above the [[stratosphere]] and directly below the [[thermosphere]]. In the mesosphere, [[temperature]] decreases as [[altitude]] increases. This characteristic is used to define its limits: it begins at the top of the stratosphere (sometimes called the [[stratopause]]), and ends at the [[mesopause]], which is the coldest part of Earth's atmosphere with temperatures below {{convert
column14: F K}}. The exact upper and lower boundaries of the mesosphere vary with latitude and with season (higher in winter and at the tropics, lower in summer and at the poles), but the lower boundary is usually located at altitudes from {{convert
column19: mi ft}} above the Earth's surface and the upper boundary (the mesopause) is usually around {{convert
column36: title=Tropical mesopause: Is it always close to 100 km?
column43: title=The Mesosphere - overview {{!}} UCAR Center for Science Education
column55: title=The mesopause altitude: Only two distinctive levels worldwide?

column6: Endeavour]]'' to straddle the [[stratosphere]] and '''mesosphere''' in this photo. The [[troposphere]], which contains clouds, appears orange in this photo.<ref>{{cite web

column1: The stratosphere and the mesosphere are sometimes collectively referred to as the \"middle atmosphere\",<ref>{{Cite web
column5: access-date=19 December 2018}}</ref> which spans altitudes between approximately 12 and 80 kilometers above the Earth's surface. The [[mesopause]], at an altitude of {{convert
column11: abbr=on}}, separates the mesosphere from the [[thermosphere]]—the second-outermost layer of the Earth's atmosphere. This is the [[turbopause]], below which different chemical species are well-mixed due to turbulent [[eddy (fluid dynamics)
column12: eddies]]. Above this level the atmosphere becomes non-uniform because the [[scale height]]s of different chemical species differ according to their [[molecular mass]]es.

column1: The term '''near space''' is also sometimes used to refer to altitudes within the mesosphere. This term does not have a technical definition, but typically refers to the region of the atmosphere up to {{convert
column4: mi ft}}, roughly between the [[Armstrong limit]] (above which humans require a [[pressure suit]] in order to survive) and the [[Kármán line]] (where [[astrodynamics]] must take over from [[aerodynamics]] in order to achieve flight); or, by another definition, to the range of altitudes above which commercial [[airliner]]s fly but below which [[satellite]]s orbit the Earth. Some sources distinguish between the terms \"near space\" and \"upper atmosphere\", so that only the layers closest to the Kármán line are described as \"near space\".

column1: Within the mesosphere, [[temperature]] decreases with increasing [[height]], due to decreasing absorption of solar radiation by the rarefied atmosphere and increasing cooling by CO<sub>2</sub> [[radiative emission]]. The top of the mesosphere, called the [[mesopause]], is the coldest part of Earth's atmosphere.<ref>{{GoldBookRef
column3: file=M03855}}</ref> Temperatures in the upper mesosphere fall as low as {{convert
column11: publisher=Atmosphere, Climate & Environment Information ProgGFKDamme (UK [[Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs]])
column14: archivedate=1 July 2010}}</ref> varying according to [[latitude]] and [[season]].

column1: The main most important features in this region are strong zonal (East-West) winds, [[atmospheric tide]]s, internal atmospheric gravity waves (commonly called \"[[gravity waves]]\"), and [[planetary wave]]s. Most of these tides and waves start in the [[troposphere]] and lower [[stratosphere]], and propagate to the mesosphere. In the mesosphere, gravity-wave amplitudes can become so large that the waves become unstable and dissipate. This dissipation deposits momentum into the mesosphere and largely drives global circulation. This helps the Earth.

[[Noctilucent cloud]]s are located in the mesosphere. The upper mesosphere is also the region of the [[ionosphere]] known as the ''D layer'', which is only present during the day when some [[ionization]] occurs with [[nitric oxide]] being ionized by [[Lyman series]]-alpha hydrogen radiation. The ionization is so weak that when night falls, and the source of ionization is removed, the free electron and ion form back into a neutral molecule. The mesosphere has been called the \"ignorosphere\" because it is poorly studied relative to the stratosphere (which can be accessed with high-altitude balloons) and the thermosphere (in which satellites can orbit).<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Upper atmosphere may hold clues in Columbia mystery

column5: abbr=on}} deep [[sodium layer]] is located between {{convert
column11: mi ft}}. Made of unbound, non-ionized atoms of sodium, the sodium layer radiates weakly to contribute to the [[airglow]]. The sodium has an average concentration of 400,000 atoms per cubic centimetre. This band is regularly replenished by sodium [[Sublimation (phase transition)
column12: sublimating]] from incoming meteors. Astronomers have begun utilizing this sodium band to create \"guide stars\" as part of the [[adaptive optics
column13: adaptive optical correction process]] used to produce ultra-sharp ground-based observations.<ref>[http://www.laserfocusworld.com/articles/print/volume-52/issue-07/features/adaptive-optics-eso-s-very-large-telescope-sees-four-times-first-laser-light.html Martin Enderlein et al., ''ESO's Very Large Telescope sees four times first light'', Laser Focus World, July 2016, pp. 22-24]</ref> Other metal layers, e.g. iron and potassium, exist in the upper mesosphere/lower thermosphere region as well.

column1: Beginning in October 2018,<ref>The \"dunes\" were first spotted by photographers in Finland and Sweden.</ref> a distinct type of [[aurora]] has been identified, originating in the mesosphere. Often referred to as 'dunes' due to their resemblance to sandy ripples on a beach, the green undulating lights extend toward the equator. They have been identified as originating about {{convert
column5: mi ft}} above the surface. Since auroras are caused by ultra-high-speed solar particles interacting with atmospheric molecules, the green color of these dunes has tentatively been explained by the interaction of those solar particles with oxygen molecules. The dunes therefore occur where mesospheric oxygen is more concentrated.<ref>[https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/new-type-aurora-ripples-across-sky-horizontal-green-dunes-180974083/?spMailingID=41658140&spUserID=NzQwNDUzNzY2MzMS1&spJobID=1682695015&spReportId=MTY4MjY5NTAxNQS2 Wu, Katherine J. A New Type of Aurora Ripples Across the Sky in Horizontal Green \"Dunes\". Smithsonian Magazine (29 January 2020)]</ref>

column1: Millions of [[meteor]]s enter the Earth's atmosphere, averaging 40,000 tons per year.<ref>Leinert C.; Gruen E. (1990). \"Interplanetary Dust\". Physics and Chemistry in Space (R. Schwenn and E. Marsch eds.). Springer-Verlag. pp. 204-275</ref> The ablated material, called meteoric smoke, is thought to serve as condensation nuclei for [[noctilucent clouds]].
The mesosphere lies above altitude records for [[aircraft]],<ref>{{cite web
column8: archivedate=11 September 2016}}</ref> while only the lowest few kilometers are accessible to [[balloons]], for which the altitude record is 53.0 km.<ref>{{cite web
column10: title=Research on Balloon to Float over 50 km Altitude
column11: publisher=Institute of Space and Astronautical Science, [[JAXA]]
column12: accessdate=29 September 2011}}</ref> Meanwhile, the mesosphere is below the minimum altitude for [[Earth orbit
column13: orbital]] [[spacecraft]] due to high atmospheric drag.<ref>{{cite web
column23: title=NASA Safety Standard 1740.14, Guidelines and Assessment Procedures for Limiting Orbital Debris
column24: publisher=Office of Safety and Mission Assurance
column30: title=100 km Altitude Boundary for Astronautics
column31: publisher=Fédération Aéronautique Internationale}}</ref> It has only been accessed through the use of [[Sounding Rocket
column32: sounding rockets]], which are only capable of taking mesospheric measurements for a few minutes per mission.<ref>{{cite web
column38: accessdate=10 October 2006}}</ref> As a result, it is the least-understood part of the atmosphere, resulting in the humorous moniker ''ignorosphere''.<ref>{{cite web
column41: title=Reusable Rockets Set to Explore the 'Ignorosphere'
column44: accessdate=2 April 2018}}</ref> The presence of [[red sprite]]s and [[blue jet]]s (electrical discharges or [[lightning]] within the lower mesosphere), [[noctilucent cloud]]s, and density shears within this poorly understood layer are of current scientific interest.

column4: Diagram showing the five primary layers of the Earth's atmosphere: [[exosphere]], [[thermosphere]], mesosphere, [[stratosphere]], and [[troposphere]]. The layers are to scale. From Earth's surface to the top of the stratosphere (50km) is just under 1% of Earth's radius.]]

column2: The layer of the atmosphere directly above the stratosphere and below the thermosphere}}

column10: Greek]] ''mesos'', \"middle\") is the third layer of the [[Atmosphere of Earth
column11: atmosphere]], directly above the [[stratosphere]] and directly below the [[thermosphere]]. In the mesosphere, [[temperature]] decreases as [[altitude]] increases. This characteristic is used to define its limits: it begins at the top of the stratosphere (sometimes called the [[stratopause]]), and ends at the [[mesopause]], which is the coldest part of Earth's atmosphere with temperatures below {{convert
column14: F K}}. The exact upper and lower boundaries of the mesosphere vary with latitude and with season (higher in winter and at the tropics, lower in summer and at the poles), but the lower boundary is usually located at altitudes from {{convert
column19: mi ft}} above the Earth's surface and the upper boundary (the mesopause) is usually around {{convert
column36: title=Tropical mesopause: Is it always close to 100 km?
column43: title=The Mesosphere - overview {{!}} UCAR Center for Science Education
column55: title=The mesopause altitude: Only two distinctive levels worldwide?

column6: Endeavour]]'' to straddle the [[stratosphere]] and '''mesosphere''' in this photo. The [[troposphere]], which contains clouds, appears orange in this photo.<ref>{{cite web

column1: The stratosphere and the mesosphere are sometimes collectively referred to as the \"middle atmosphere\",<ref>{{Cite web
column5: access-date=19 December 2018}}</ref> which spans altitudes between approximately 12 and 80 kilometers above the Earth's surface. The [[mesopause]], at an altitude of {{convert
column11: abbr=on}}, separates the mesosphere from the [[thermosphere]]—the second-outermost layer of the Earth's atmosphere. This is the [[turbopause]], below which different chemical species are well-mixed due to turbulent [[eddy (fluid dynamics)
column12: eddies]]. Above this level the atmosphere becomes non-uniform because the [[scale height]]s of different chemical species differ according to their [[molecular mass]]es.

column1: The term '''near space''' is also sometimes used to refer to altitudes within the mesosphere. This term does not have a technical definition, but typically refers to the region of the atmosphere up to {{convert
column4: mi ft}}, roughly between the [[Armstrong limit]] (above which humans require a [[pressure suit]] in order to survive) and the [[Kármán line]] (where [[astrodynamics]] must take over from [[aerodynamics]] in order to achieve flight); or, by another definition, to the range of altitudes above which commercial [[airliner]]s fly but below which [[satellite]]s orbit the Earth. Some sources distinguish between the terms \"near space\" and \"upper atmosphere\", so that only the layers closest to the Kármán line are described as \"near space\".

column1: Within the mesosphere, [[temperature]] decreases with increasing [[height]], due to decreasing absorption of solar radiation by the rarefied atmosphere and increasing cooling by CO<sub>2</sub> [[radiative emission]]. The top of the mesosphere, called the [[mesopause]], is the coldest part of Earth's atmosphere.<ref>{{GoldBookRef
column3: file=M03855}}</ref> Temperatures in the upper mesosphere fall as low as {{convert
column11: publisher=Atmosphere, Climate & Environment Information ProgGFKDamme (UK [[Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs]])
column14: archivedate=1 July 2010}}</ref> varying according to [[latitude]] and [[season]].

column1: The main most important features in this region are strong zonal (East-West) winds, [[atmospheric tide]]s, internal atmospheric gravity waves (commonly called \"[[gravity waves]]\"), and [[planetary wave]]s. Most of these tides and waves start in the [[troposphere]] and lower [[stratosphere]], and propagate to the mesosphere. In the mesosphere, gravity-wave amplitudes can become so large that the waves become unstable and dissipate. This dissipation deposits momentum into the mesosphere and largely drives global circulation. This helps the Earth.

[[Noctilucent cloud]]s are located in the mesosphere. The upper mesosphere is also the region of the [[ionosphere]] known as the ''D layer'', which is only present during the day when some [[ionization]] occurs with [[nitric oxide]] being ionized by [[Lyman series]]-alpha hydrogen radiation. The ionization is so weak that when night falls, and the source of ionization is removed, the free electron and ion form back into a neutral molecule. The mesosphere has been called the \"ignorosphere\" because it is poorly studied relative to the stratosphere (which can be accessed with high-altitude balloons) and the thermosphere (in which satellites can orbit).<ref>{{cite web
column3: title=Upper atmosphere may hold clues in Columbia mystery

column5: abbr=on}} deep [[sodium layer]] is located between {{convert

column4: Rottweil.ogg}}) is a town in southwest [[Germany]] in the state of [[Baden-Württemberg]]. Rottweil was a [[Free Imperial City]] for nearly 600 years.

column1: Located between the [[Black Forest]] and the [[Swabian Jura
column2: Swabian Alps]], Rottweil has about 25,000 inhabitants. The old town is famous for its [[medieval]] center and for its traditional [[carnival]] (called \"[[Fastnacht
column4: Swabian]] dialect). It is the oldest town in Baden-Württemberg,<ref>Website of Dominikaner Museum Rottweil (retrieved May 22, 2014), on permanent display is a wooden table from August 4, AD 186 naming arae flaviae as [[municipium]] thus making Rottweil the oldest town in Baden-Württemberg [http://www.dominikanermuseum.de/cms/?q=node/3] {{webarchive
column6: date=2014-05-21 }}</ref> and its appearance has changed very little since the 16th century.

column1: Rottweil was founded by the [[Ancient Rome
column3: Arae Flaviae]] and became a ''[[municipium]]'', but there are traces of human settlement going back to 2000 BC. [[Thermae
column4: Roman baths]] and an [[Orpheus mosaic]] of c. AD 180 date from the time of Roman settlement. The present town became a ducal and a royal court before 771 and in 1268 it became a [[Free Imperial City]].

column1: In 1463 Rottweil joined the [[Old Swiss Confederacy
column2: Swiss Confederacy]] under the pretence of a temporary alliance. In 1476 the Rottweilers fought on the Swiss side against [[Charles the Bold]] in the [[Battle of Morat]]. In 1512, Pope Julius II gave the city a valuable [[Juliusbanner
column3: \"Julius banner\"]] for its services in the 1508-1510 \"Great Pavier Campaign\" to expel the French.<ref>{{cite web
column6: title=The Julius Banner of the Village of Rottweil
column9: accessdate=2019-01-25}}</ref> In 1519, the Rottweilers left the old Swiss alliance. They joined a new one in which their membership was extended indefinitely – the so-called \"Eternal Covenant\".

column1: Rottweil thus became a centre of the Swiss Confederation. The relations between the Swiss Confederation and Rottweil cooled rapidly during the Reformation. When Rottweil was troubled by wars, however, it still asked the Confederates for help.<ref>{{cite web

In the [[Rottweil Witch Hunts]] from 1546 to 1661, 266 so-called witches, wizards and magicians were executed in the imperial city of Rottweil. On April 15, 2015, they were given a posthumous pardon. An official apology was given by the City Council about 400 years after their violent death.<ref>{{cite book
column4: title=\"Im Rauch gehen Himmel geschüggt\", Hexenverfolgung in der Reichsstadt Rottweil,

column1: Rottweil lost both its status as free city and its alliance with the Swiss Confederacy with the conquest of the region by [[Napoleon]] in 1803.
* 1965–1985: Ulrich Regelmann, mayor, from 1970 Lord Mayor

column3: Gothic]]–era ''Münster Heiliges Kreuz'' (\"Minster of the Holy Cross\"), built over a pre-existing church from 1270. It features a [[crucifix]] by [[Veit Stoss]] and noteworthy Gothic sculptures.

column1: * ''Kapellenkirche'' (1330–1340), a Gothic church with a tower and with three statue-decorated portals.
* ''Lorenzkapelle'' (\"Church of St. Lawrence\", 16th century) in late Gothic style. It houses some two hundred works by Swabian masters and Gothic altarpieces from the 14th and 15th centuries.
* The town's museum, including a notable Roman mosaic with the legend of [[Orpheus (mythology)

column2: Romanesque]] church from the 12th century. Excavations have brought to light Roman baths on the same site.
Dominican Museum of Rottweil]] – local branch of the [[Landesmuseum Württemberg]]

column1: * As of 2015, [[ThyssenKrupp]] was constructing a $45 million, {{convert
column5: adj=on}} tower. The tower is a research facility for the company and is to be used to test new elevator cars and technologies. At 807 feet, it is the tallest structure in the district. The windowless building is to have 12 elevator shafts.<ref>{{Cite news
column9: title = Elevators Elevate German City's Image

column3: St. Veronica's sudarium]] over the portal of the [[Minster (church)

column2: [[Rottweil station]] 2018 and [[ThyssenKrupp]] Test Tower in the background

column1: * The [[Rottweiler]] dog is named after this town; it used to be a butcher's dog in the region.
* [[Adam of Rottweil]], the 15th-century scholar and printer, was born in Rottweil.
* \"Das Mädchen aus Rottweil\" is a song by the German band [[Die Toten Hosen]]
* Egon Rieble (1925–2016), art historian and dialect poet
* Hermann Schäfer (1927–2009), composer and music scientist
* Kurt Bantle (born 1933), politician ([[SPD]]), former member of the Landtag
* [[Franz Xavier Wernz]] (1842–1914), [[Superior General of the Society of Jesus
* [[Erwin Teufel]] (born 1939), politician ([[Christian Democratic Union of Germany
column2: CDU]]), former minister president of Baden-Württemberg

column1: * Thomas Engeser (born 1948), Lord Mayor of Rottweil 2001–2009
* Rita Haller-Haid (born 1950), politician (SPD), member of the Landtag 2001-2016
* Ralf Broß (born 1966), Lord Mayor of Rottweil since 2 July 2009
* [[Andreas Schwab]] (born 1973), politician (CDU) and member of the European Parliament

column8: date=21 February 2009}}</ref> is Chairman and CEO of the Hyde Park Entertainment Group, and was formerly CEO of National Geographic Films.

column1: An internationally renowned award-winning producer, Amritraj has made over 100 films during the span of his 35-year career, with worldwide revenues in excess of $2 billion.<ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> He has partnered with every major studio in Hollywood and produced films starring the likes of Dwayne \"The Rock\" Johnson,<ref>{{Cite web
column18: title=It Is The Time Of Disruption: Ashok Amritraj
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> Bruce Willis, Sandra Bullock, Sylvester Stallone, Angelina Jolie, Cate Blanchett, Dustin Hoffman, Andrew Garfield, Steve Martin, Antonio Banderas,<ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=It Is The Time Of Disruption: Ashok Amritraj
column32: title=Toronto: Elmore Leonard’s ‘Life Of Crime’ Near U.S. Deal With Lionsgate/Roadside
column42: title=\"Ghost Rider 2\" poised to ignite lackluster franchise

column1: Amritraj’s extraordinary career from Wimbledon tennis player to billion dollar Hollywood producer (chronicled in his autobiography Advantage Hollywood<ref>{{Cite book
column9: pages=}}</ref>) is matched only by his commitment to education, diversity, and gender equality. Dedicating a significant amount of his time to philanthropic endeavors worldwide, in 2016 Amritraj was appointed as the first United Nations India Goodwill Ambassador for the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals.<ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Hyde Park Entertainment’s Ashok Amritraj on His New Role as India Goodwill Ambassador
column19: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> In December 2018, by decree of the President of the Republic of France, Amritraj was appointed a Chevalier (Knight) of the Ordre National du Merité.<ref>{{Cite web
column21: title=Ashok Amritraj Decorated by French Government

column1: Amritraj has grown Hyde Park into a cutting-edge independent alternative to the traditional Hollywood system, fully realizing his vision for a progressive global company that incorporates the most essential elements of a full-fledged studio. Hyde Park’s mandate encompasses feature film, television, digital, documentary, and local language content, with the Company possessing development, production, and financing capabilities in addition to handling worldwide sales and marketing.
Amritraj has had box office hits such as GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE, starring Nicolas Cage,<ref>{{Cite news
column3: title=Movie Projector: 'Ghost Rider' sequel to scorch competition
column8: issn=0458-3035}}</ref> BRINGING DOWN THE HOUSE, starring Steve Martin,<ref>{{Cite web
column18: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> PREMONITION, starring Sandra Bullock,<ref>{{Cite web
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> WALKING TALL starring The Rock, and many more, as well as critically acclaimed titles including 99 HOMES starring Andrew Garfield and Michael Shannon, BLUE VALENTINE starring Ryan Gosling and Michelle Williams,<ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=Right Cinema: Blue Valentine is an Indie Film
column28: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and SHOPGIRL, starring Steve Martin and Claire Danes.<ref>{{Cite web
column30: title=Fox takes international on Hyde Park ‘Shopgirl’

column1: Amritraj’s current projects include: supernatural thriller, PREY, in partnership with Blumhouse Productions,<ref>{{Cite web
column3: title=Hyde Park-Image Nation & Blumhouse Partner For ‘Prey’
column11: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> PASHMINA, a Major Animated Musical in partnership with Netflix, to be directed by Gurinder Chadha and with music by Oscar-winner A.R. Rahman,<ref>{{Cite web
column13: title=Netflix Teams With Gurinder Chadha & Ashok Amritraj’s Hyde Park To Turn Nidhi Chanani Graphic Novel ‘Pashmina’ Into Animated Musical
column21: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and FORDLANDIA, a Television event series, to be directed by Werner Herzog at AMC Studios.<ref>{{Cite web
column23: title=‘Fordlandia’ Novel Being Adapted For TV; Werner Herzog To Direct

column1: Hyde Park Entertainment Group and its artists have received awards and recognition from the major award shows and film festivals including the Oscars, the BAFTA awards, the Emmys, the Independent Spirit Awards, the Cannes Film Festival, the Golden Globes, and many more.
Amritraj serves on the Producers Executive Board of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences<ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and on the advisory board for the Dodge Film School at Chapman University.<ref>{{Cite web
column8: title=Dodge College Moves Up to #6 Spot in The Hollywood Reporter’s Annual Ranking of Top 25 Film Schools - Maintains ‘Top 10’ Status for 5th Consecutive Year

column8: date=21 February 2009}}</ref> is Chairman and CEO of the Hyde Park Entertainment Group, and was formerly CEO of National Geographic Films.

column1: An internationally renowned award-winning producer, Amritraj has made over 100 films during the span of his 35-year career, with worldwide revenues in excess of $2 billion.<ref>{{Cite web
column6: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> He has partnered with every major studio in Hollywood and produced films starring the likes of Dwayne \"The Rock\" Johnson,<ref>{{Cite web
column18: title=It Is The Time Of Disruption: Ashok Amritraj
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> Bruce Willis, Sandra Bullock, Sylvester Stallone, Angelina Jolie, Cate Blanchett, Dustin Hoffman, Andrew Garfield, Steve Martin, Antonio Banderas,<ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=It Is The Time Of Disruption: Ashok Amritraj
column32: title=Toronto: Elmore Leonard’s ‘Life Of Crime’ Near U.S. Deal With Lionsgate/Roadside
column42: title=\"Ghost Rider 2\" poised to ignite lackluster franchise

column1: Amritraj’s extraordinary career from Wimbledon tennis player to billion dollar Hollywood producer (chronicled in his autobiography Advantage Hollywood<ref>{{Cite book
column9: pages=}}</ref>) is matched only by his commitment to education, diversity, and gender equality. Dedicating a significant amount of his time to philanthropic endeavors worldwide, in 2016 Amritraj was appointed as the first United Nations India Goodwill Ambassador for the 17 UN Sustainable Development Goals.<ref>{{Cite web
column11: title=Hyde Park Entertainment’s Ashok Amritraj on His New Role as India Goodwill Ambassador
column19: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> In December 2018, by decree of the President of the Republic of France, Amritraj was appointed a Chevalier (Knight) of the Ordre National du Merité.<ref>{{Cite web
column21: title=Ashok Amritraj Decorated by French Government

column1: Amritraj has grown Hyde Park into a cutting-edge independent alternative to the traditional Hollywood system, fully realizing his vision for a progressive global company that incorporates the most essential elements of a full-fledged studio. Hyde Park’s mandate encompasses feature film, television, digital, documentary, and local language content, with the Company possessing development, production, and financing capabilities in addition to handling worldwide sales and marketing.
Amritraj has had box office hits such as GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE, starring Nicolas Cage,<ref>{{Cite news
column3: title=Movie Projector: 'Ghost Rider' sequel to scorch competition
column8: issn=0458-3035}}</ref> BRINGING DOWN THE HOUSE, starring Steve Martin,<ref>{{Cite web
column18: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> PREMONITION, starring Sandra Bullock,<ref>{{Cite web
column23: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> WALKING TALL starring The Rock, and many more, as well as critically acclaimed titles including 99 HOMES starring Andrew Garfield and Michael Shannon, BLUE VALENTINE starring Ryan Gosling and Michelle Williams,<ref>{{Cite web
column25: title=Right Cinema: Blue Valentine is an Indie Film
column28: access-date=2019-07-03}}</ref> and SHOPGIRL, starring Steve Martin and Claire Danes.<ref>{{Cite web
